intro: Pelea fulva, commonly known as the yellow pelea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Pelea fulva is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
